definition-item.definition-title: EXPLOSIVES OR THERMIC COMPOSITIONS (blasting F42D); MANUFACTURE THEREOF; USE OF SINGLE SUBSTANCES AS EXPLOSIVES (compounds in general C01, C07 or C08; {demolition agents based on cementitious or like materials C04B41/0009})

section-body.paragraph-text: Explosive compositions: compositions included are those containing both a fuel and sufficient oxidiser so that, upon initiation, they are capable of undergoing a chemical reaction of a relatively high rate of speed, resulting in the production of usable force for blasting, firearms, propelling missiles, or the like.

list-item.paragraph-text: a consumable fuel component which consists of any element which is a metal, B, Si, Se or Te, or mixtures, compounds, or hydrides thereof; and
in combination an oxidant component which is either a metal oxide or a salt (organic or inorganic) capable of yielding a metal oxide on decomposition.

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions which are fuels for rocket engines and intended for reaction with an oxidant, excluding air, in order to provide thrust for motive power purposes.
Compositions used for affecting the explosion environment, e.g. for neutralising the poisonous gases of explosives or for cooling the explosion gases.
Methods or apparatus for preparing or treating, e.g. working-up, the compositions mentioned above, not otherwise provided for in the IPC.
Methods of using single substances as explosives.
Compositions mentioned above, defined by structure or arrangement of the components or products.

This subclass does not cover chemical compounds or their preparation as such, which subject matter is covered by classes C01 (inorganic chemistry), C07 (organic chemistry) and C08 (organic macromolecular compounds).
The use of explosive or thermic compositions for welding operations is classified in subclass B23K, the compositions as such used therefor are additionally classified in subclass C06B.

table-column.paragraph-text: Demolition agents based on cementious or like materials
Detonating or priming devices, fuses, chemical lighters or pyrophoric compositions
Mechanical aspects of coated explosive charges

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making harmful chemical substances harmless or less harmful, by effecting a chemical change in the substances
Inflatable occupant restraints characterized by the inflation fluid source
Rocket-engine plants, i.e. plants carrying both fuel and oxidant therefor
Production or use of heat not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subclass, methods or apparatus for preparing or treating compositions are classified according to the particular components of the compositions.
In this subclass, with the exception of group C06B21/00, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, a composition is classified in the last place that provides for an ingredient.
In this subclass, the words "based on", with reference to explosive compositions, refer to the explosive ingredient present in the largest proportion by weight
Methods or apparatus for preparing or treating compositions are classified accoding to the particular compositions.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compounds having a nitro group or a nitrate ester group.

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or methods for working-up explosives, e.g. forming, cutting, drying

section-body.paragraph-text: Installations, transport means and apparatus in general

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture of blasting caps and primers

section-body.paragraph-text: In the absence of an indication to the contrary a process is classified in the last appropriate place, e.g. granulation by extrusion and chopping C06B21/0075.

definition-item.definition-title: {Compounding the ingredient}

section-body.paragraph-text: Mixers, mobile mixing installations and mixing processes.

definition-item.definition-title: {the ingredient being nitrocellulose or oranitro cellulose based propellant; Working up; gelatinising; stabilising (stabilising of explosives in general C06B21/0091)}
{the ingredient being a polymer bonded explosive or thermic component}
{Shaping the mixture}

section-body.paragraph-text: Grinding of powders and shaping of bodies in general.

table-column.paragraph-text: Grinding of powders to defined particle sizes

definition-item.definition-title: {by compression}
{By a process involving melting at least part of the ingredients}

section-body.paragraph-text: Sintering processes and melting point depressing agents in as far as it concerns the process.

definition-item.definition-title: {by casting a curable composition, e.g. of the plastisol type}
{by granulation, e.g. flaking}

section-body.paragraph-text: Grinding powders to defined particle sizes
Sifting of powders for obtaining defined particle size distributions

definition-item.definition-title: {by extrusion}
{Treatment of solid structures, e.g. for coating or impregnating with a modifier (compositions therefor C06B23/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Inhitor modifiers for making inhibitor layers.

definition-item.definition-title: {Elimination of undesirable or temporary components of an intermediate or finished product, e.g. making porous or low density products, purifying, stabilising, drying; Deactivating; Reclaiming; (porous inert particles or chemicals compounded for these purposes C06B23/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Drying processes such as freeze-drying and flash-drying.

table-column.paragraph-text: Porous inert particles or chemicals compounded for these purposes
Compositions of hydrophobing, dehydrating or other agents for working up

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions characterised by non-explosive or non-thermic constituents {(in combination with specific explosives C06B25/20, C06B25/26, C06B29/04, C06B29/08, C06B31/06, C06B31/40, C06B33/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Exercise munition containing small amounts of explosives.

definition-item.definition-title: {Fillers, gelling and thickening agents (e.g. fibres) , absorbents for nitroglycerine (binders, plasticisers for propellants C06B45/10; crosslinking or curing agents C06B45/10)}
{Porous or hollow inert particles (preparation C06B21/0091)}
{Desensitisers, phlegmatisers (coolants for mining explosives C06B23/04; deactivating C06B21/0091)}
{Stabilisers (e.g. thermal stabilisers) (processes C06B21/0091; foam stabilisers C06B23/002)}
for neutralising poisonous gases from explosives produced during blasting

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Explosives based upon chlorate comprising an alkaline nitrate

definition-item.definition-title: for cooling the explosion gases {including antifouling and flash suppressing agents}

section-body.paragraph-text: Reducing visibility of combustion products of rockets on radar

table-column.paragraph-text: Generation of gas for vehicle safety bags

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions containing a nitrated organic compound

list-item.paragraph-text: Nitrated organic compounds not covered by subgroups
Nitrated organic single substances used as explosive

definition-item.definition-title: the nitrated compound being an aromatic

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of nitrated aromatic compounds are:

definition-item.definition-title: the compound being nitroglycerine

section-body.paragraph-text: Nitroglycerine and other glycerine or glycerine derivatives being fluid nitric acid esters.

definition-item.definition-title: the compound being nitrocellulose present as 10% or more by weight of the total composition

section-body.paragraph-text: Nitrocellulose in combination with an explosive plaasticizer or gelatinizer not covered by subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: with nitroglycerine
with an organic non-explosive or an organic non-thermic component

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions characterised by non-explosive or non-thermic constituents

definition-item.definition-title: the compound being nitrated pentaerythritol

section-body.paragraph-text: Composition containing nitrated pentarythritol, e.g. mixture of PETN (pentaerythritol tetranitrate) and TNT (trinitrotoluene) called Pentolite

definition-item.definition-title: the compound being a nitrated acyclic, alicyclic or heterocyclic amine

section-body.paragraph-text: Composition containing compound being a nitrated acyclic, alicyclic or heterocyclic amine , e. g. RDX, (T4 or cyclotrimethylenetrinitramine), HMX, (octogen or octahydro-1,3,5,7-tetranitro-1,3,5,7-tetrazocine),Nitroguanidine, HNIW (hexanitrohexaazaisowurtzitane or Cl-20), TEX, (4,10-dinitro-2,6,8,12-tetraoxa-4,10-diazatetracyclo dodecane, TNAZ (1,3,3,-trinitroazetidine), mixture of RDX and TNT called Cyclotol or Composition B

table-column.paragraph-text: Aromatic nitrated amines such asNitroaniline, Hexanitrodiphenylamine, Napthaline

definition-item.definition-title: the compound being a nitroparaffin
Compositions containing a metal, boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium or mixtures, intercompounds or hydrides thereof, and hydrocarbons or halogenated hydrocarbons

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing metals, the elements boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium, blends thereof, combination or binary compound formed with hydrogen of the elements; hydrogen-carbon (hydrocarbons) or non-metal group 17 hydrogen-carbon (halogenated hydrocarbons)

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions containing an inorganic oxygen-halogen salt, e.g. chlorate, perchlorate

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing carbonless oxygen-non metal Group 17 elements, such as salts derived from perchloric acid (ClO4-), chlorate (ClO3-)
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions containing an inorganic nitrogen-oxygen salt with a metal oxygen-halogen salt
Compositions containing particulate metal, alloy, boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium with at least one oxygen supplying material the material being an inorganic oxygen-halogen salt
Compositions containing a metal fulminate with an inorganic oxygen-halogen salt

definition-item.definition-title: with an organic non-explosive or an organic non-thermic component

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions or products which are defined by structure or arrangement of component of product the organic component containing a resin

definition-item.definition-title: the salt being ammonium perchlorate

section-body.paragraph-text: Ammonium perchlorate in combination with components ,which correspond to the classes C06B29/04 - C06B29/20

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions containing an inorganic nitrogen-oxygen salt

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing carbonless nitrogen-oxygen salt such as (ammoniumdinitramide) (ADN)

definition-item.definition-title: with carbon or sulfur

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing alkali metal or alkaline earth metal nitrate with carbon or sulfur, e.g. black powder

definition-item.definition-title: with an organic non-explosive or an organic non-thermic component

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions containing an inorganic oxygen-halogen salt

table-column.paragraph-text: Mixtures of AN and a liquid other than an oil
Slurries made from ANFO and water

definition-item.definition-title: with vegetable matter; with resin; with rubber

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing ammonium nitrate with other organic non-explosive substances, e.g vegetable matter, resin, rubber

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions containing particulate metal, alloy, boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium with at least one oxygen supplying material which is either a metal oxide or a salt, organic or inorganic, capable of yielding a metal oxide

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing metals, alloys, silicon, selenium or tellurium with at least one oxygen yielding-compound, e,g. metal oxide
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with an organic non-explosive or an organic non-thermic component

section-body.paragraph-text: Composition containing metal, alloy, silicon, selenium or tellurim with at least one oxygen yielding component and an organic compound lacking a detonation part (non explosive or non-thermic), e.g. a metal and a polymer
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: the material being an inorganic nitrogen-oxygen salt

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing metals, alloys, silicon, selenium or tellurium with carbonless nitrogen-oxygen salt
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions containing an inorganic nitrogen-oxygen salt

definition-item.definition-title: the material being an inorganic oxygen-halogen salt

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions containing metals, alloys, silicon, selenium or tellurium with carbonless oxygen- non-metal Group 17 salt
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions characterised by non-explosive or non-thermic constituents

definition-item.definition-title: the material being two or more oxygen-yielding compounds

section-body.paragraph-text: Two different oxidizers mean that they are physically separately present in the composition.
Particles of mixed oxidizer (one oxidizer containing a mixture of oxides) is not considered as a mixture.

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions containing a metal azide

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions containing a nitrated metallo-organic compound with a metal azide

definition-item.definition-title: with free metal, alloy, boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions containing a metal, boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium or mixtures, intercompounds or hydrides thereof, and hydrocarbons or halogenated hydrocarbons

Compositions containing particulate metal, alloy, boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium with at least one oxygen supplying material which is either a metal oxide or a salt, organic or inorganic, capable of yielding a metal oxide

definition-item.definition-title: with a metal azide or a metal fulminate

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions characterised by explosive or thermic constituents not provided for in groups C06B25/00 - C06B41/00

section-body.paragraph-text: Fuel - air mixtures, explosive gas mixtures, organic perchlorate salts, tetrazoles etc.

definition-item.definition-title: Compositions or products which are defined by structure or arrangement of component of product (explosive charges of particular form or shape F42B1/00, F42B3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Aspects related to structure like particle size, shapes, porosity etc.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shape or structure of solid propellant charges for rocket-engine plants
Explosive charges of particular form or shape

definition-item.definition-title: comprising solid particles dispersed in solid solution or matrix {not used for explosives where the matrix consists essentially of nitrated carbohydrates or a low molecular organic explosive}

table-column.paragraph-text: Explosives where the matrix consists essentially of nitrated carbohydrates or a low molecular organic explosive]

definition-item.definition-title: the organic component containing a resin

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions comprising solid particles dispersed in solid solution or matrix comprising organic component containing a resin, e.g. plasticizers, crosslinkers, polymer catalysts, polymers being present as a matrix forming component and not as particles.
Polymers per se are classified in C08
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions containing an inorganic oxygen-halogen salt with an organic non-explosive or an organic non-thermic component
Compositions containing ammonium nitrate with resin; with rubber

definition-item.definition-title: having contiguous layers or zones

section-body.paragraph-text: This group covers compositions or products defined by having contiguous layers or zones, e.g.:

list-item.paragraph-text: Layers on propellant charges, which are non-explosive

table-column.paragraph-text: Blasting cartridges, i.e. case and explosive
Surface treatment of cartridges or cartridge cases

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Charging rocket engines with solid propellants; Methods or apparatus specially adapted for working solid propellant charges

definition-item.definition-title: comprising a coated component (particles dispersed in a matrix C06B45/04; coated explosive charges F42B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions including a covering, i.e. coated component base containing organic explosive or organic thermic component, coated component base containing inorganic explosive or inorganic thermic component or coated component base containing both organic explosive or thermic component and inorganic explosive or thermic component

definition-item.definition-title: the component base containing an inorganic explosive or an inorganic thermic component

Compositions in which the components are separately stored until the moment of burning or explosion, e.g. "Sprengel"-type explosives; Suspensions of solid component in a normally non-explosive liquid phase, including a thickened aqueous phase

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions that have two or more parts isolated by structure prior to detonation
Emulsion type explosives in which a solid component is not compulsory
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Generation of pressure gas by reaction of two or more liquids
Generation of pressure gas by reaction of solids with liquids

definition-item.definition-title: a component being a liquefied normally gaseous material supplying oxygen (C06B47/04 takes precedence)
a component containing free boron, an organic borane or a binary compound of boron, except with oxygen

table-column.paragraph-text: Binary compounds of boron with oxygen

definition-item.definition-title: {Water in oil emulsion type explosives in which a carbonaceous fuel forms the continuous phase}
Use of single substances as explosives

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions characterised by explosive or thermos constituents not provided for in groups C06B25/00 - C06B41/00
